dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 5030 IH: Secure Rural Schools Reauthorization Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Neguse (for himself, Mrs. Rodgers of Washington, Ms. Hoyle of Oregon, Mr. LaMalfa, Mr. Huffman, Mr. Fitzpatrick, Ms. Porter, and Ms. Wild) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture, and in addition to the Committee on Natural Resources, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To extend the Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Secure Rural Schools Reauthorization Act of 2023.

section.header: Extension of Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000

subsection.header: Secure payments for States and counties containing Federal land

paragraph.text: Section 101 of the Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 (16 U.S.C. 7111) is amended, in subsections (a) and (b), by striking 2023 each place it appears and inserting 2026.

paragraph.header: Distribution of payments to eligible counties
paragraph.text: Section 103(d)(2) of the Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 (16 U.S.C. 7113(d)(2)) is amended by striking 2023 and inserting 2026.

subsection.header: Extension of authority To conduct special projects on Federal land

paragraph.text: Section 205(a)(4) of the Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 (16 U.S.C. 7125(a)(4)) is amended by striking December 20, 2023 each place it appears and inserting December 20, 2026.
Section 208 of the Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 (16 U.S.C. 7128) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (a), by striking 2025 and inserting 2028; and
in subsection (b), by striking 2026 and inserting 2029.

subsection.header: Extension of authority To expend county funds
subsection.text: Section 305 of the Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 (16 U.S.C. 7144) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a), by striking 2025 and inserting 2028; and
in subsection (b), by striking 2026 and inserting 2029.

section.header: Resource advisory committee pilot program extension
section.text: Section 205 of the Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 (16 U.S.C. 7125) is amended by striking subsection (g) and inserting the following:

subsection.header: Pilot program for resource advisory committee appointments by regional foresters

paragraph.text: The Secretary concerned shall establish and carry out a pilot program under which the Secretary concerned shall allow the regional forester with jurisdiction over a unit of Federal land to appoint members of the resource advisory committee for that unit, in accordance with the applicable requirements of this section.

Before appointing a member of a resource advisory committee under the pilot program under this subsection, a regional forester shall conduct the review and analysis that would otherwise be conducted for an appointment to a resource advisory committee if the pilot program was not in effect, including any review and analysis with respect to civil rights and budgetary requirements.

Nothing in this subsection relieves a regional forester or the Secretary concerned from an obligation to comply with any requirement relating to an appointment to a resource advisory committee, including any requirement with respect to civil rights or advertising a vacancy.
The authority provided under this subsection terminates on October 1, 2028.
